    • Method Detail

      • registerCard

        @PostMapping("/register_card")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CreditCardDTO> registerCard​(@RequestBody @Valid
                                                                           @Valid CreditCardDTO newCreditCard)
        This route create a new register of a credit card from a buyer;
        Parameters:
        newCreditCard - (CreditCardDTO) containing: cardOwner(BuyerDTO), cardName(String),limitTotal(Double), limitAvailable(Double), status(Boolean);
        Returns:
        Http response status 201: CREATED, body: CreditCardDTO;
        Throws:
        ExceededCapacityException - - when the value of the available limit is greater than the total limit;
        ElementAlreadyExistsException - - when a credit card with this card number already exists in the databases;
        ElementNotFoundException - - when the buyer does not exist in the database;
        See Also:
        CreditCard

      • getCreditCardLimits

        @GetMapping("/limits/{cardId}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> getCreditCardLimits​(@PathVariable
                                                                                     long cardId)
        This route return a String with limitTotal and limitAvailable from a credit card
        Parameters:
        cardId - (long);
        Returns:
        Http response status ok, body: String;
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - - when the credit card with this id do not exist in the databases;
        See Also:
        CreditCard

      • getCreditCardBill

        @GetMapping("/bill/{cardNumber}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<CartResponseDTO>> getCreditCardBill​(@PathVariable
                                                                                                  java.lang.String cardNumber)
        this route returns a collection of carts that were purchased by this credit card
        Parameters:
        cardNumber - (String);
        Returns:
        Http response status ok, body: List;
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - - when the credit card with this id does not exist in the databases;

        CartResponseDTO

      • getWallet

        @GetMapping("/wallet/{buyerId}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<CreditCardDTO>> getWallet​(@PathVariable
                                                                                        long buyerId)
        this route returns a valid buyer's card wallet - wallet is a collection of credit cards from the same buyer
        Parameters:
        buyerId - (long);
        Returns:
        Http response status ok, body: List;
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - - when the buyer with that id does not exist in databases;
        See Also:
        CartResponseDTO

      • buyCart

        @PutMapping("/buy_cart/{cartId}/{cardNumber}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> buyCart​(@PathVariable
                                                                         java.lang.Long cartId,
                                                                         @PathVariable
                                                                         java.lang.String cardNumber)
        this route buy an existing cart open, passing its status to finished and debiting the total value of this cart from the available limit of the credit card
        Parameters:
        cartId - (long), cardNumber(String);
        Returns:
        Http response status ok, body: String;
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - - when a credit card with this card number does not exist in the databases;;
        ExceededCapacityException - - when a credit card are locked (CreditCard.status = false) ;
        ElementNotFoundException - - when a cart with this id does not exist in the databases;
        ElementAlreadyExistsException - - when a cart with this id are already finished (cart.status = "Finished");
        ExceededCapacityException - - when the available limit of the credit card is less than the total value of the cart;

      • updateStatus

        @PutMapping("/update_status/{cardNumber}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> updateStatus​(@PathVariable
                                                                              java.lang.String cardNumber)
        this route changes the status of the credit card from the card number
        Parameters:
        cardNumber - (String);
        Returns:
        Http response status ok, body: String;
        Throws:
        ElementNotFoundException - - when a credit card with this card number does not exist in databases;
